title: Intraspinal injection of human mesenchymal stromal cells in SOD1G93A ALS mice
segmentation: So thank you for the chance to present my results of the intraspinal injection.

So first I would like to introduce to you the idea behind the cellular therapy and a LS and this that we want to protect the motor neurons via non neuronal cells and it was shown before that these cells are crucial for the survival of the motor neurons.

There already stem cell studies going on in human LS patients, but there's no data of pace we twice yet available regarding the efficiency of the treatment and we use amazing camastro muscles which have white proliferation and differentiation potential.
They easily available and release new protective factors and cytokines.
So in 2006, International Society for Cellular Therapy published a position paper to define minimal criteria for the embassies, and these criteria are that they have to be adhering to plastic.
They should express CD105, for example, or and they should not express different surface markers such as CD 45.
And they it must be shown that they are capable to differentiate into adipocytes, Chantal plus and osteoblasts.

And based on this criteria, we established a protocol for the isolation of human MSCS, and our goal is to establish a good manufacturing practice protocol, and for this we have a Corporation with the GM pdev unit of the medical school Hannover.
And 1st, we isolate the human embassies from the.
A member of healthy donors and then we sell select them via plastic adherence.
The next step is then to show that the embassies are capable to differentiate into the chondrocytes, which we show.
Why is a alcian blue staining which you?
Can see here and here.
We have the negative control and then we different.
Yet the embassies into adipocytes and for to show that it was successful.
We used the alredo standing which you can see here.
And then to show that the embassies are able to differentiate into osteocytes, we use the Eliteserien wet staining.
And then the neck.
Criteria, expression or not.
Expression of different surface markers for the suite developed of facts panel to analyze embassies and to see if they are viable or not, and.
So you can see here that our embassy say a viable for this.

We use is 780 staining and for example you can see here the tennessees and expressing expressing CD 73 and CD 105, but they're not expressing CD 40, Nancy D 45 and with all of this we show that our isolated MSCS fulfilled the criteria of the International Society for Cellular Therapy.
We then did an in vitro characterization of the MCS to see whether they secrete potential neuroprotective factors, and.

You can see here that for this purpose we used to Bio Plex, Multiplex immunoassays, and we used the condition medium and we showed that the CNT FBDNF&BG&F are secreted via the embassies and the factor kind.
They're also secreted in.
These factors seem to have have neuroprotective potential.
And then we started to do in vivo studies of the embassies.
And the end of this study is out of preclinical evaluation of the administration of human embassies, and for this purpose we wanted to compare the frequency of intraspinal injection.
Whether it is better to inject the MSS once or twice, and we did also involving in vivo imaging of the MSCS via radioactive tracing.
And for this purpose I used the Black Six as JL sod one mouse model.
And for this intraspinal injection I for the.

Single injection I operated under my eyes at the edge of day 40 and pulls the double injection at day 14, day 90 and the injection site was at T13 to everyone and I injected size into the left and right are ventral horn per site.
I injected one 100,000 cells in a volume of 1 microliter Saline and the control group received one microliter salon.
And to evaluate the progress of the disease, we used the survival time and general condition scoring system, which you can see here ranging from 5 to 1, meaning 5.
The animal is completely healthy and have with one is a stage of the disease reached in.
The animals are no longer able to write some type within 5 seconds and we did also measure the weight and performed the water were test and footprint.
Now I would like to present to you the results of the singer and trust final injection at Day 40.
I had two groups here.
One receiving the Saline and is shown as a black continuous line here and the one the group receiving their Matthias is shown as the blue dotted line and for survival we're not seeing any difference.
And for the general condition also we're not seeing any different.
But when we look at the rate, we're observing a twofold significant difference for the embassy, treated mice, and but for the water performance, we're not seeing any difference.
When we look at the footprints, we are not observing any difference in the embassy treated mice.
And now I would like to present to user results of the double interest final injection that day, 14 Day 19.
Here I had two sweet groups, 1 receiving Saline at Day 40 and at Day 90 and as shown here is a black continuous line.
One group received the embassies at Day 40 and Saline at Day 19.
Dash owners are blue dotted line and the third group received.
Emma sees at Day 40 and Day 90 and is shown as a dotted purple line.
And here we see a trend towards survival for the double injection of fantasies at the.
The animals are living longer for the general condition.
We have no significant difference.
When we look at the weight, we observe a significant difference was a double injection of embassies.
And but when we look at the road performance, there's no difference.
And for the one time we are having a significant improvement for the double injection of embassies.
But for that at length we are not having a significant difference.

We then did the radioactive tracing of Emma season for this purpose, we incubated success was 400 Mega Becquerel of Floridas articular cause for 60 minutes with ended the interaction of the embassies in the spinal cord and scans it the animals directly after surgery and after 1 two and four hours after the injection.
Here you can see the results of one animal.
We have a signal here in the bladder, which means that some cells are get working due to the injection and this is the way we are seeing them because it's cleared out here.
But here we have really strong signal at the spinal cord at the targeted side and this stays strong over the four hours.
So we can say that really part of the embassies are reaching the injection.
Titan stays there for at least four hours.

And to summarize my results for the single injection, we have a significant effect in weight loss for the double injection at a 14 day 90, we have a significant difference in weight loss and runtime, and a trend towards prolonged survival and for the in vivo imaging with radioactive tracer, we can detect embassies in the spinal cord.
So.

So the next steps will be to compare whether it is better to inject the embassies intraspinal ER into articular and we want to do immuno histochemical analysis of motor neuron loss and glial activation.
And we want to analyze the survival of the embassies after injection overtime.
For this purpose we want to use more stable radioactive markers.
I would like to thank my supervisors and all my colleagues and cooperation partners and say.
Thank you for your attention.
